item.title: Report X-2023090224
item.description:
Report X-2023090224

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-26T18:14:26+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-07
  • City: MIAMI GARDENS
  • State: FL
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: RESPONDED TO A PACKAGE THAT WAS COLD TO THE TOUCH WITH FROST FORMING ON THE OUTER PACKAGING. UPON INSPECTION OF THE CONTENTS DISCOVERED APPROXIMATELY 15 LBS OF DRY ICE COOLING WILD CAUGHT SCAMPI. THERE ARE NO DANGEROUS GOODS MARKS OR LABELS ON THE OUTER BOX. THIS PACKAGE WAS SHIPPED USING UPS ACCOUNT NUMBER 0777RW, QZINA SPECIALTY FOODS, 2600 SW 32ND AVE., HOLLYWOOD FL 33023.

item.title: Report I-2023090106
item.description:
Report I-2023090106

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-25T03:13:31+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-01
  • City: FORT LAUDERDALE
  • State: FL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: SOUTHWEST AIRLINES CO.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: Passenger carrying a container of dry ice filled with medicine. Southwest was not made aware of the dry ice packaging by the passenger and passed through the security checkpoint. The dry ice was not packaged properly to release the buildup of pressure resulting in an explosion during pushback. Crew returned to the gate and was meet by LEO, EMS and city fire department. No injuries were reported, EMS evaluated passengers and crew upon deplaning. Pictures available upon request.

item.title: Report E-2023090439
item.description:
Report E-2023090439

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-20T15:12:40+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-12
  • City: MIAMI
  • State: FL
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: AT THE UPS FACILITY IN MIAMI, FLORIDA, CARGO WAS BEING INSPECTED FOR AIR MOVEMENT TO NICARAGUA. ONE BOX WAS FOUND TO HAVE SIGNS OF MARKS AND LABELS HAVING PREVIOUSLY BEEN CUT OFF THE PACKAGE. INNER CONTENT INSPECTION REVEALED LITHIUM BATTERY PACKS FOR HP LAPTOPS INSIDE THE BOX.

  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0

  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: PACKAGE WAS DISCOVERED DUE TO PREVIOUS LEAKER BY SHIPPER, SO THE PACKAGE WAS INSPECTED AND 1 GALLON OF ON OFF HULL BOTTOM CLEANER WAS FOUND. THERE WAS NO INDICATION OF HAZARDOUS MATERIAL ON THE OUTER PACKAGE OR THERMAL LABEL. ACCORDING TO SDS, MATERIAL IS HAZARDOUS RESPONDER CALLED HAZMAT HELP DESK.

item.description:

  • City: POMPANO BEACH

  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Box was found leaking in the damage area and was placed in a hazmat bag and tote and brought to the hazmat cage to be processed. DescribePack: 1 of the gallon bottles of reagent alcohol had a loose cap and a damaged safety seal. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Box was placed in a hazmat bag and tote and brought to the hazmat cage to be processed.

item.title: Report X-2023081967
item.description:
Report X-2023081967

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-26T18:14:26+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-25
  • City: ORLANDO
  • State: FL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: The box was found damaged in the load area and moved to the hazmat cage for reports. DescribePack: The box had been put into overhead sortation. During sortation, the 5-gallon metal pail in the box was dented up, causing the lid to come loose and leak out contents. When the box was open for inspection, it was found that the pail was upside down in the box. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: The box was placed into a lined tote.

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: The hazmat box was found wet in the unload and moved to the hazmat cage for reports. DescribePack: The 20 liter bladder bag in the box had a small puncture on it's side, causing contents to leak out. There were no punctures in the outer box. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: The box was placed upright into a hazbag lined tote.

  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident

  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: The package was loaded to a van when it was discovered wet and it was placed in a hazmat bag and bin for further containment and inspection. DescribePack: All 4 plastic bottles of SafeClean Equipment Hygiene Solution leaked from loose caps. Caps were not secured and only slotted partitions were used as inner packaging materials. The box also got wet with machinery oil from another damaged package that leaked out. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Upon discovery the wet package was placed in a hazmat bag and bin for further containment. No release was found.

  • Description: SequenceEvent: Received leaking 5 gallon steel pail of ZEP brake wash on the unload side leaking from a dented, bent lid. The pail was contained in a hazmat bag and pail and brought to the QA cage for processing, DescribePack: The lid failed due to be dented somehow during transportation. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: The metal pail was placed into a hazmat bag and pail to prevent leakage from going on to any packages nearby or equipment.

  • Description: SequenceEvent: Hazmat was being unloaded from preload sort when a package handler quickly identified the damaged hazmat and brought it to the sort managers attention. After then it was brought to QA for inspection and damage report. DescribePack: Due to the leakage from the loose caps the package sustained heavy damage to the top of the box/packaging. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: After inspection caps were retightened and tested to ensure that they will contain the corrosive liquid and for future PGH disposition.

  • Description: No Ieakage was noticed at time of pick up, but once unloading at facility was started it was found that 1-2 gallons had leaked onto pallet and trailer floor. There was a small crease about 3/4 ways down the drum that we expect opened up in transit. The location of damage on the drum was interfacing on the pallet preventing visual inspection.
